intro: Maeviella, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Maeviella is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
